intro: Dactylorhiza traunsteineri var. patula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marsh orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous habitats such as marshes and fens. The plant has slender, erect stems with few leaves, and its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color. It produces a single spike of flowers, each with three sepals and three petals, with the lateral petals being hooded. This orchid is known for its specialized pollination mechanisms and is often found in nutrient-poor environments.
